senses.de: The act of identifying or acknowledging someone or something
senses.ex: My forgetfulness often prevents me from achieving quick recognition of old friends.

Tips.title: Social Context
Tips.description: Use when you suddenly realize who someone is or remember something.
Tips.example: It took me a moment, but then I had a flash of recognition.

Tips.title: Not Just Visual
Tips.description: Recognition can be through any senses, like recognizing a voice on the phone.
Tips.example: I heard laughter and, with instant recognition, knew it was my brother.

senses.de: The appreciation or acknowledgement of the good quality or value of someone or something
senses.ex: He received an award in recognition of his bravery.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Often used when someone's efforts are formally acknowledged and valued.
Tips.example: Her work with the homeless did not go without recognition from the community.

Tips.title: Motivational
Tips.description: Being given recognition can motivate people to keep up good work.
Tips.example: The students were given recognition for their academic performance.

senses.de: The formal acknowledgement that a country or government exists and is valid
senses.ex: The US gave formal recognition to the new government.

Tips.title: Political Importance
Tips.description: Recognition confirms legitimacy and can affect international relations.
Tips.example: The recognition of the new country was an important milestone in its history.

Tips.title: Not Always Positive
Tips.description: Recognition doesn't mean approval, but simply acknowledgment of existence.
Tips.example: The government's recognition of the rebel group as a belligerent party changed the dynamics.

senses.de: The ability of a machine or computer program to identify and respond to images, sounds, or patterns
senses.ex: Voice recognition software can transcribe spoken words into written text.

Tips.title: Technology Advancement
Tips.description: Indicates an advanced level of technology with human-like understanding abilities.
Tips.example: Facial recognition systems are becoming increasingly adept at identifying individuals.

Tips.title: User Interface
Tips.description: Used for user-friendly technology that interacts in intuitive ways.
Tips.example: Smart homes that use voice recognition can adjust the lighting and temperature just by speaking.

Appreciate.wordDefinition:
Appreciate means to value and admire something or someone. It is applicable in situations where we want to express our gratitude or acknowledge the worth of something or someone.

Appreciate is used when we want to express our admiration or gratitude while recognition is used when we want to acknowledge someone for their hard work or achievements.

Approval.wordDefinition:
Approval and recognition are two different words with different meanings.

Approval refers to the act of agreeing or accepting something, usually after careful consideration or evaluation. It means giving permission and support to something or someone.

For example, a parent may give their approval to their child's decision to attend a particular college.

Approval is applicable when someone needs permission or support for something, while recognition is applicable when someone needs appreciation or acknowledgment for their achievements or contributions.

Commendation.wordDefinition:
Commendation means to praise or approve someone's actions or behavior.

It is usually given as a result of doing something exceptional, praiseworthy, or beyond what is expected. For example, a soldier may receive a commendation for bravery during battle.

Commendation is given for exceptional actions or behavior, while recognition is given for noteworthy contributions or achievements.

Credit.wordDefinition:
Credit refers to acknowledging or giving recognition to someone for their work, effort or contribution. This recognition often takes the form of giving praise, acknowledgement or reward to someone who has done something admirable or noteworthy.

Credit is usually given in a formal or official capacity, such as in an academic or professional setting, such as school or work.

Credit is a more specific term that refers to acknowledging someone's specific accomplishments or contributions, while recognition is a broader term that refers to acknowledging or noticing someone or something in general.

Esteem.wordDefinition:
Esteem refers to the respect and admiration one has for someone or something.

It is used when talking about the high regard one has for a person's qualities or achievements. For instance, a person might have esteem for their parents, teachers, or friends, based on their individual characteristics.

Esteem is a positive feeling one has toward someone or something, while recognition is the act of acknowledging someone for their effort or accomplishments.

Honour.wordDefinition:
Honour and recognition are both words used to describe giving someone credit for their achievements or character.

Honour describes respect and admiration given to someone who has demonstrated their worthiness, often by displaying virtues such as bravery, honesty, or loyalty.

Honour can also refer to a sense of personal pride or integrity that somebody displays in their actions.

Honour is more specific and refers to a specific set of qualities or actions, while recognition is a broader term that can encompass a range of achievements and attributes.

Both honour and recognition are important ways of showing appreciation and acknowledging someone's worth, and can be applied in a variety of contexts.

Notice.wordDefinition:
Both notice and recognition refer to the act of acknowledging something or someone. Notice usually means realizing the presence or existence of something, while recognition refers to identifying something or someone and acknowledging its/their value or significance.

For instance, if you see a new poster on your bedroom wall, you might notice it, meaning you become aware that it's there.

Similarly, you might notice a person you've never met before in the hallway at school, simply because they cross your path.

Notice is used more for objective observations, while recognition includes a subjective element of value or familiarity.

Tribute.wordDefinition:
Tribute refers to an expression of respect, admiration, or gratitude towards someone or something.

It is often applicable in more informal or personal settings, such as memorials, funerals, or personal speeches. For example, a tribute may be made to a loved one who passed away, to a military hero, or to a cultural icon.

Recognition is a formal acknowledgement of achievement or contribution, while tribute is a more personal expression of respect or gratitude.

quotes.Text: As an actor, I think it's really important to be as anonymous as possible. It's your job to convince people that you are somebody else, and so any recognition I'd get away from the screen - well, it's not something I actively seek. To be honest with you, I'm surprised anybody does.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Jodhi May

quotes.Text: After appearing for eight seasons as a beloved character on 'Supernatural,' it's not surprising that I get most of my recognition on the street from that, and it happens with some frequency. But I'm not a guy who gets recognized often.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jim Beaver

quotes.Text: Women tend to have recognition and peer group support - recognition from friends and family that this has to be a big issue in their lives. They're more comfortable expressing the need for support and receiving it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: James Levine

quotes.Text: From where I've come from, I look back at everything, all these people that influenced my life as a kid growing up in a really bad environment, it just makes it all worthwhile in terms of the recognition.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Goldie

quotes.Text: What little return documentary filmmakers get often comes in the form of recognition by their peers and the critics who influence doc audiences around the country.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Yance Ford

quotes.Text: If I'm a content creator, and I get recognition for my work, that's going to motivate me to spend even more time on my next production and make it even better.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Nick Woodman

quotes.Text: It's always nice to be getting personal recognition, but I wouldn't be getting it if it wasn't for the help of my team-mates and the backroom staff.
quotes.Title: Scottish Athlete
quotes.Name: John McGinn

quotes.Text: Creating my own world in a comic or selling my first penny newspaper aged nine was a way of gaining recognition and acceptance by my peers.
quotes.Title: American Publisher
quotes.Name: Hugh Hefner

quotes.Text: I am being selfish here by saying this, but I believe 'Barfi!' helped me the most. It got me recognition and respect.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Ileana D'Cruz

quotes.Text: You need characters who want things. They want love, they want recognition, they want happiness.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Candace Bushnell
